jsx.core
Class Maths

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.core.Maths

public final class Maths
extends Disposable

A utility class providing useful mathematical functions and constants with its static methods.

Users are encouraged to use the utilities provided by this class instead of the opaque methods of MathLike or JsGlobal.Math in consideration of the reuse benefit for re-compilation results.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
MathLike, JsGlobal.Math

atan2

public static final double atan2(java.lang.Object y,
                                 java.lang.Object x)

Computes the arc tangent of the ratio y/x. The y argument can be considered the Y coordinate (or "rise") of a point, and the x argument can be considered the X coordinate (or "run") of the point. Note the unusual order of the arguments to this function: the Y coordinate is passed before the X coordinate.

Parameters:
y - The Y coordinate of the point.
x - The X coordinate of the point.
Returns:
A value between -pi and pi radians that specifies the counterclockwise angle between the positive X axis and the point (x, y).
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.atan2(Object, Object), JsGlobal.Math.atan2(Object, Object)

Returns:
TThe closest integer greater than or equal to x.

cos

Computes a cosine.

Parameters:
x - An angle, measured in radians. To convert degrees to radians, multiply the degree value by 0.017453293 (2pi/360).
Returns:
The cosine of the specified value x. This return value is between -1.0 and 1.0.
Since:
1.0

exp

public static final double exp(java.lang.Object x)

Computes a power of e.

Parameters:
x - A numeric value or expression to be used as the exponent.
Returns:
e raised to the power of the specified exponent x, where e is the base of the natural logarithm, with a value of approximately 2.71828.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.exp(Object), JsGlobal.Math.exp(Object)

floor

public static final double floor(java.lang.Object x)

Rounds a number down.

This function computes the floor function. In other words, it returns the nearest integer value that is less than or equal to the function argument.

This function rounds a floating-point value down to the closest integer. This behavior differs from that of round(Object), which rounds up or down to the nearest integer. Also note that this function rounds negative numbers down (that is, to be more negative), not up (that is, closer to zero).

Parameters:
x - Any numeric value or expression.
Returns:
The closest integer less than or equal to x.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.floor(Object), JsGlobal.Math.floor(Object)

Parameters:
x - Any numeric value or expression greater than zero.
Returns:
The natural logarithm of x.

max

public static final java.lang.Number max(java.lang.Object x,
                                         java.lang.Object y)

Returns the larger of two numbers.

Parameters:
x - Any value.
y - Any value.
Returns:
The larger of the two arguments. Returns -Infinity if the arguments are all undefined. Returns NaN if any of the arguments is NaN or is a non-numeric value that cannot be converted to a number.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.max(Object, Object), JsGlobal.Math.max(Object, Object)

pow

public static final double pow(java.lang.Object x,
                               java.lang.Object y)

Computes x to the power of y.

Any values of x and y may be passed to this function. However, if the result is an imaginary or complex number, it returns NaN. In practice, this means that if x is negative, y should be a positive or negative integer. Also, bear in mind that large exponents can easily cause floating-point overflow and return a value of Infinity.

Parameters:
x - The number to be raised to a power.
y - The power that x is to be raised to.
Returns:
x to the power of y.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.pow(Object, Object), JsGlobal.Math.pow(Object, Object)

random

public static final double random()

Computes a random number.

Returns:
A pseudo-random number between 0.0 and 1.0.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.random(), JsGlobal.Math.random()

round

public static final double round(java.lang.Object x)

Rounds to the nearest integer.

This invocation rounds its argument up or down to the nearest integer. It rounds .5 up. For example, it rounds 1.5 to 2 and rounds -1.5 to -1.

Parameters:
x - Any number.
Returns:
The integer closest to x.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.round(Object), JsGlobal.Math.round(Object)

sqrt

public static final double sqrt(java.lang.Object x)

Computes a square root.

Note that you can compute arbitrary roots of a number with pow(Object, Object).

Parameters:
x - A numeric value greater than or equal to zero.
Returns:
The square root of x. Returns NaN if x is less than zero.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
MathLike.sqrt(Object), JsGlobal.Math.sqrt(Object)
